div.div: στέμμα , ατος (στέφω): chaplet or fillet of a priest. Chryses takes the fillet from his head and places it upon his sceptre, because he comes as a suppliant, Il. 1.14. (The cut shows the band in two positions—as extended at full length, and as wrapped around the head. In the second representation the ends should hang down by the sides of the head below the ears, Il. 1.28.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
